result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J Degroot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Denying Motion for Release on Bond Pending Appeal signed by Judge Laura Lau 05/07/2020.

11:49 AM Defendant Derek J Degroot in court, in custody at Stanley Correctional.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek J Degroot appeared by video means.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.   Case called for hearing to address Defendant's Motion for Release on Bond Pending Appeal.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Sitzberger objects and presents statements.  Defendant responds.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court denies Defendant's Motion for Release on Bond Pending Appeal.  Court to prepare an order from the hearing today.
Dated April 30, 2020.  IT IS ORDERED that the petition for a supervisory writ is dismissed.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion for relief is denied.
Bail/bond hearing on May 7, 2020 at 11:45 am.

Defendant filed a petition for a supervisory writ.  In it, he complains that the circuit court has failed to promptly hold a hearing on his motion for release on bond pending appeal, as required by WIS. STAT. 809.31(2).  We conclude that a response to the petition is warranted.  If the matter is scheduled for a hearing before the dealine to file a response, the petition and accompanying motion for relief will be dismissed/denied as moot.  The deadline to file a response will not be tolled by orders extending appellate deadlines due to the pandemic.  
Therefore,
IT IS ORDERED that the respondent shall file a response to the petition for a supervisory writ within fourteen days after the service of this order.

09:54 AM Defendant Derek J Degroot in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek J Degroot appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court addresses defendant's motion for attorney to withdraw.  Statements by defendant.  Statements by Attorney Lochowicz.  For the reasons stated on record the Court grants the defendant's motion and will allow the defendant to proceed pro se for his appeal.  Attorney Lochowicz is discharged.  Attorney Lochowicz to submit order.

Citing computer software or disc problems, court reporter, Marilyn Annen moves to further extend by more than sixty days the time to file the transcripts requested in this case, to September 7, 2018.  The transcripts were originally due on May 1, 2018; by order of this court that deadline was extended to July 2, 2018.  Based on the set of facts set forth in the motion, the court concludes that good causse exists for the relief requested.   Therefore,
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing the transcript(s) in this case is extended to September 7, 2018.

For Non-Appearance at Day 3 of Jury Trial.
Branch #5 ONLY - Body ONLY.
CODE 1

Jury Trial - Day THREE
Continued from 11/01/17.
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   
Defendant Derek J Degroot did not appear.   
Cases:  14CF1531, 15CF908 & 15CF909 all joined for trial - called together.  

Defendant did not appear - Case scheduled for 8:30 am. and Matter called @ 9 am.
Court will continue with the Jury Trial without the defendant.
Court also revokes bail on all cases, issues a warrant on each case, Branch #5 ONLY - Body ONLY.

Jurors entered the courtroom @ 9:06 am.
Court instructed the jurors about the defendant's non-appearance.

Witness Called:  Mark Degroot (Defendant's Brother).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Defense rests.
Juror excused for a brief adjournment @ 9:25 am.
Court in brief adjournment @ 9:27 am.

Court back on the record @ 9:53 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:58 am.

State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.

Court read the jury instructions and verdicts to the jurors.
Bailiff sworn in.
Court selected the alternate juror.
Jurors excused for deliberation @ 11:24 am.
Court thanked the alternate for his service - alternate juror excused.
Court addressed with the parties exhibits that could go back to the jurors if requested.
Court in adjournment @ 11:30 am.

Jurors notified the bailiff they had a verdict @ 2:11 pm.
Court back on the record @ 2:44 pm.
Jurors back in the courtroom @ 2:49 pm.

Court read the verdicts:
Case:  14CF1531 - Count 1 - 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child - GUILTY.
                                - Count 2 - Child Enticement-Sexual Contact - GUILTY.
                                - Count 3 - Possess Drug Paraphernalia - GUILTY.

Case:  15CF 908 - Count 1 - Bail Jumping-Felony - GUILTY

Case:  15CF909 - Count 1 - 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - GUILTY.
                              - Count 2 - 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - GUILTY.

State asks for receipt of the verdicts.
Defense requests the Jurors be polled.
Clerk polled the jurors.
State and Defense are satisfied with the polling of the verdicts.
Court receives the verdicts and enters judgment.
Court thanked the jurors.
Jurors excused @ 2:57 pm.

Jury Trial - Day TWO
Continued from 10/31/17.
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Derek J Degroot in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  
Cases:  14CF1531, 15CF908 & 15CF909 all joined for trial - called together.

Defendant wants to fire his counsel and proceed pro-se, statements presented.
Court addressed the defendant's request to fire his counsel and proceed pro-se.
Court Denies the defendant's request - reasons placed on the record.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:07 am.

Witness Called:  Sgt. Scott Sheridan (City of Muskego Police Department),
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for a brief adjournment @ 9:50 am.
Court in brief adjournment @ 9:50 am.

Court back on the record @ 10:13 am.
Jurors back in the courtroom @ 10:14 am.

Witnesses Called:  Mary Degroot (Defendant's Mother), Victim (A.L.), Natalya Stolbenko (Citizen Witness) and Victim (A.L.'s) Mother (J.P.).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for lunch @ 12:19 pm.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:20 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:43 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 1:47 pm.

Witnesses Called:  Officer Christopher Bloom (City of Waukesha Police Department), Special Agent Ann Sheridan (WI Dept. of Justice) and Det. Stephen Westphal (City of Muskego Police Department).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Exhibit Marked:  22 - 46, 48 - 49 & 55 - 56.
Exhibit Offered and Received:  22 - 46, 48 - 49 & 55 - 56.

State rests.
Juror excused for a brief adjournment @ 3:03 pm.
Court in brief adjournment @ 3:04 pm.

Court back on the record @ 3:27 pm.
Defense makes a motion to dismiss all three cases - Stating the State has not met their burden of proof.
State objects and presented arguments.
Court Denies - Defense Motion to Dismiss.
The State has met their burden of proof, and made a prima facia showing.
Further reasons placed on the record.

Court addressed with the defendant his right to testify or not testify.
Court conducts colloquy.
Defendant chooses not to testify.
Court accepts the defendant's decision not to testify.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 3:38 pm.
Court provided the jurors with instructions.
Jurors excused for the evening @ 3:40 pm.

Court addressed with the parties proposed juror instructions and verdicts.
Court also addressed procedure for tomorrow with the parties.
Court also addressed with the parties the exhibits that would be sent back to the jurors (if requested) during deliberations.

Court in adjournment @ 4:43 pm.

Exhibits 1 - 50, 52 - 54 & 56 from jury trial - All Scanned.
Exhibit 51 & 55 - DVD's - Not Scannable - Stored in exhibit room - Will need to be retained for the retention period from final disposition date.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges - Strike Sheet.

One Alphabetical Voir Dire List.
One Random Voir Dire List.

Jury Trial - Day ONE
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Derek J Degroot in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  
Cases:  14CF1531, 15CF908 & 15CF909 all joined for trial - called together.

State presented statements to the court.
Court addressed with the parties the way in which he will read the charges.
Court had decided to empanel an alternate and each side will have 5 strikes.
Court addressed with the parties courtroom practice/procedures.

Court addressed with the parties Motions in Limine.
Defense is objecting to the facebook messages and phone download evidence - arguments presented.
State will not be introducing the text messages from the phone download.
State presented response to the defense objections to the facebook messages - arguments presented.
Defense presented authentication arguments.
Court presented his decision - reasons placed on the record.
Court did address with the parties conducting individual voir dire.

JAR has 49 potential jurors for our trial.
48 Potential Jurors sent up @ 10:11 am. (one juror sent home due to illness).
All potential jurors sworn in.

Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.
Court in brief adjournment @ 11:17 am.
Court back on the record @  11:30 am.
Defense conducts voir dire.
Juror 5 struck for cause.
New juror called up - voir dire conducted by all parties.

Parties conduct their strikes.
Clerk reads the 13 selected names - 13 selected jurors sworn in by the clerk.
Non-Selected jurors returned to the JAR @ 12:12 pm.
Jurors excused @ 12:12 pm.
State placed the sidebar on the record.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 12:17 pm.
Court addressed the jurors as to procedure.

Jurors excused for lunch @  12:21 pm.
Defense requests that jury instruction 50 be read to the jurors prior to opening statements - Arguments presented.
State takes no position.
Court Denies - Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds jeopardy is now attached (jurors are sworn in) and the defendant is expected to be here.
